abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed project would develop
            coffee production through: (a) rehabilitating and developing
            Ngoli and Kateshi coffee estates to 450 ha producing, at
            full development, about 800 tons of clean coffee plus about
            2,000 tons of maize; (b) rehabilitating and developing
            smallholder coffee production in the Northern and
            Northwestern Provinces and (c) strengthening the national
            coffee research institutions. The project would save for the
            country about US$2.2 million per annum in coffee import
            substitution and earn about US$0.2 million per annum in
            maize exports. It would provide annual employment for about
            960 persons.
